merrell648t - 2010-08-17 05:36 CET:
@full_anka

Actually, the first account of the word \"fuck\" didn\'t come till around the 1400\'s, making the use in this movie historically inaccurate.


...pretty much every word we use today (in english) has not been used by the romans, as they obviously spoke latin. so from your point of view, every "historically based movie" is incorrect as the characters use words that didn't exist back then. durr!

there are, however, a lot of latin swear words, which were perfectly common amongst the normal people:

mentula - dick
muliebris - faggot
merda - shit
etc.

plus, there's even a direct correspondence between fuck and a latin word, although it's not certain wheter they're related

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fuck#Via_Latin_or_Greek

and what i was trying to say with my first comment: people cussed in every culture and/or language. one of the most common english cuss words is fuck, so it's certainly not a bad option for expressing cuss words of the respective language.
